title: Batch mode
text: Batch detrending applies routine images directory. directory images want detrend don’t, put ones want detrend directory detrend directory. put resulting images wherever like. First decide whether images need thresholded . , need thresholded don’t, put separate directories detrend separately. Always remember check thresholding worked satisfactorily employed. detrend directory path///dir e.g. Huang thresholding, run go without thresholding, just run make new directory called detrended within path///dir contain detrended TIFF images. named way make clear detrended detrended (method parameters). legacy methods also batch modes. example, use exponential filtering detrending, use dir_detrend_exp().
code: dir_detrend_robinhood("path/to/some/dir", thresh = "Huang") dir_detrend_robinhood("path/to/some/dir")

what: An image in need of detrending
title: Detrending single images
text: package contains sample image series can found atsystem.file("extdata", "2ch100frame.tif", package = "detrendr"). ’s 2 channels 100 frames. Diffusing fluorescent particles imaged. Protein labelled red dye red photons collected channel 1. Protein B labelled green green photons collected channel 2. image can read R read_tif() command provided ijtiff package. ’ll assign variable called my_img. my_img now 4-dimensional array. Slots 1 2 hold y x pixel positions, slot 3 indexes channel slot 4 indexes frame. Plotting mean intensities frames two channels, can see second channel obvious bleaching.  However, notice channel 2 bleaches 29 27 approximately 7%. ’s much, little correction necessary. good, always endeavour keep bleaching 20% bleaching correction (detrending) viewed necessary evil. mean intensity channel 1 0.81 mean intensity channel 2 25.13. Let’s view mean intensity images channels 1 2.
code: path <- system.file("extdata", "2ch100frame.tif", package = "detrendr") print(path) #> [1] "/Users/runner/work/_temp/Library/detrendr/extdata/2ch100frame.tif" my_img <- read_tif(path) #> Reading 2ch100frame.tif: an 8-bit, 30x28 pixel image of #> unsigned integer type. Reading 2 channels and 100 frames . . . #> Done. dim(my_img) #> [1]  30  28   2 100 #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_smooth()`). #> Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). #> Using basic display functionality. #>   * For better display functionality, install the EBImage package. #>   * To install `EBImage`: #>     - Install `BiocManager` with `install.packages("BiocManager")`. #>     - Then run `BiocManager::install("EBImage")`. #> Using basic display functionality. #>   * For better display functionality, install the EBImage package. #>   * To install `EBImage`: #>     - Install `BiocManager` with `install.packages("BiocManager")`. #>     - Then run `BiocManager::install("EBImage")`.

title: Detrending single images
text: can see image part cell, edge cell across top left hence top left corner image cell, just background. ’s important threshold away background part: detrending routine assumes parts image part region interest (cell), need set background parts NA beforehand tell detrending routine area excluded. detrendr thresholding functionality ImageJ Auto Threshold plugin. can read https://imagej.net/plugins/auto-threshold. favourite method Huang. Let’s look channels Huang thresholding.  seems worked: background region top left now greyed , indicating set NA. Huang thresholding can slow, want something similar faster, try Triangle. Always check thresholding looks right afterwards. Thresholding images done autothresholdr package. Thresholding stack preformed mean_stack_thresh() thresholds away pixels stack whose mean intensity less certain threshold value. Note image interest, thresholding necessary done.
code: #> Using basic display functionality. #>   * For better display functionality, install the EBImage package. #>   * To install `EBImage`: #>     - Install `BiocManager` with `install.packages("BiocManager")`. #>     - Then run `BiocManager::install("EBImage")`. #> Using basic display functionality. #>   * For better display functionality, install the EBImage package. #>   * To install `EBImage`: #>     - Install `BiocManager` with `install.packages("BiocManager")`. #>     - Then run `BiocManager::install("EBImage")`. my_img_threshed <- autothresholdr::mean_stack_thresh(my_img, "Huang")

title: Detrending single images
text: best detrending method Robin Hood, ’ll using . detrending methods provided package legacy reasons. detrend thresholded Robin Hood algorithm, run Let’s check mean intensity profiles detrended image.  mean intensity profiles neatly show image series detrended. Beware, however, mean intensity profiles great way compare detrending routines. temptation say whichever detrending routine finishes flattest mean intensity profile best, true possible -detrend (-flatten mean intensity profile). rigorous procedures needed compare detrending routines, example using images simulated photobleaching trend-inducing phenomena introduced.
code: my_detrended_img <- img_detrend_robinhood(my_img_threshed)

title: Detrend Images
text: Detrending technique remove unwanted trends time-series data. Image series (videos) may viewed collection time series: pixel time series, value time t intensity value pixel frame recorded time t. Detrending applied image series fields fluorescence fluctuation correlation spectroscopy (FCS FFS) remove trends introduced photobleaching also possible sources trends laser power fluctuation. detrendr R package detrending image series. ’re new R ’re want use detrendr, warned need learn basic R first. recommend reading short book “Hands Programming R” Grolemund. available free https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/. enough want reading, check “R Data Science” available free https://r4ds..co.nz/. website gives introduction detrendr package, assuming reader basic level R knowledge.

what: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree
title: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree
text: Use Nolan's algorithm find ideal polynomial degree polynomial detrending.

title: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree
code: best_degree(img, parallel = FALSE, purpose = c("FCS", "FFS"))

title: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree
text: img 4-dimensional array style ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, channel, frame]) 3-dimensional array single channel ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, frame]). parallel like use multiple cores speed function? , set number cores , use available cores, use parallel = TRUE. purpose type calculation intend perform detrended image? FFS (fluorescence fluctuation spectroscopy) calculation (like number brightness), choose 'FFS'. FCS (fluorescence correlation spectroscopy) calculation (like cross-correlated number brightness autocorrelation), choose 'FCS'. difference purpose 'FFS', time series corrected non-stationary mean variance, whereas purpose 'FCS', time series corrected non-stationary mean . purpose required Robin Hood detrending.

title: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree
text: detrend necessary, function returns NA. detrend required, function returns natural number ideal polynomial degree polynomial detrending. multiple channels, function returns vector, one degree parameter channel.

title: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree
text: Rory Nolan, Luis . J. Alvarez, Jonathan Elegheert, Maro Iliopoulou, G. Maria Jakobsdottir, Marina Rodriguez-Muñoz, . Radu Aricescu, Sergi Padilla-Parra; nandb—number brightness R novel automatic detrending algorithm, Bioinformatics, https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btx434.

title: Find the best polynomial degree for polynomial detrending. — best_degree

title: Detrend all TIFF images in an entire folder. — detrend-directory
code: dir_detrend_robinhood(   folder_path = ".",   swaps = "auto",   thresh = NULL,   quick = FALSE,   msg = TRUE )  dir_detrend_rh(   folder_path = ".",   swaps = "auto",   thresh = NULL,   quick = FALSE,   msg = TRUE )  dir_detrend_boxcar(   folder_path = ".",   l,   purpose = c("FCS", "FFS"),   thresh = NULL,   parallel = FALSE,   msg = TRUE )  dir_detrend_exp(   folder_path = ".",   tau,   purpose = c("FCS", "FFS"),   thresh = NULL,   parallel = FALSE,   msg = TRUE )  dir_detrend_polynom(   folder_path = ".",   degree,   purpose = c("FCS", "FFS"),   thresh = NULL,   parallel = FALSE,   msg = TRUE )

title: Detrend all TIFF images in an entire folder. — detrend-directory
text: folder_path path (relative absolute) folder wish process. swaps number swaps (giving one count rich poor) perform Robin Hood detrending. Set "auto" (default) use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different swaps channel specifying swaps vector list. thresh threshold thresholding method (see autothresholdr::mean_stack_thresh()) use image prior detrending. quick FALSE (default), swap finding routine run several times get consensus best parameter. TRUE, swap finding routine run . msg Receive messages tell processing directory going? Default yes. l length parameter boxcar detrending. size sliding window 2 * l + 1. must positive integer. Set "auto" use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different l channel specifying l vector list. purpose type calculation intend perform detrended image? FFS (fluorescence fluctuation spectroscopy) calculation (like number brightness), choose 'FFS'. FCS (fluorescence correlation spectroscopy) calculation (like cross-correlated number brightness autocorrelation), choose 'FCS'. difference purpose 'FFS', time series corrected non-stationary mean variance, whereas purpose 'FCS', time series corrected non-stationary mean . purpose required Robin Hood detrending. parallel like use multiple cores speed function? , set number cores , use available cores, use parallel = TRUE. tau \(tau\) parameter exponential filtering detrending. must positive number. Set "auto" use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different tau channel specifying tau vector list. degree degree polynomial use polynomial detrending. must positive integer. Set "auto" use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different degree channel specifying degree vector list.

title: Detrended image class. — detrended_img
text: detrended_img 4-dimensional array positive integers style ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, channel, frame]) result detrending routine. 4 attributes: parameter value parameter used. l, tau degree parameter respective methods. auto boolean TRUE parameter found automatically FALSE manually selected. purpose Either "FCS" "FFS" denote whether detrending done purpose fluorescence correlation spectroscopy fluorescence fluctuation spectroscopy calculations respectively. purpose required Robin Hood detrending.

title: Detrended image class. — detrended_img
code: detrended_img(img, method, parameter, auto, purpose = NULL)

title: Detrended image class. — detrended_img
text: img detrended image series. 4-dimensional array non-negative integers style ijtiff_img, 3-dimensional array non-negative integers represents single channel ijtiff_img-style array (indexed img[y, x, frame]). method method used. One "robinhood", "boxcar", "exponential" "polynomial". parameter number. detrend parameter used. One per channel. auto Logical. automatic detrending used? One per channel. purpose Either "FCS" "FFS". image detrended purpose FCS FFS calculations? See detrending. purpose required Robin Hood detrending.

title: Detrend images. — detrending
text: img 4-dimensional array style ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, channel, frame]) 3-dimensional array single channel ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, frame]). swaps number swaps (giving one count rich poor) perform Robin Hood detrending. Set "auto" (default) use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different swaps channel specifying swaps vector list. quick FALSE (default), swap finding routine run several times get consensus best parameter. TRUE, swap finding routine run . l length parameter boxcar detrending. size sliding window 2 * l + 1. must positive integer. Set "auto" use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different l channel specifying l vector list. purpose type calculation intend perform detrended image? FFS (fluorescence fluctuation spectroscopy) calculation (like number brightness), choose 'FFS'. FCS (fluorescence correlation spectroscopy) calculation (like cross-correlated number brightness autocorrelation), choose 'FCS'. difference purpose 'FFS', time series corrected non-stationary mean variance, whereas purpose 'FCS', time series corrected non-stationary mean . purpose required Robin Hood detrending. parallel like use multiple cores speed function? , set number cores , use available cores, use parallel = TRUE. tau \(tau\) parameter exponential filtering detrending. must positive number. Set "auto" use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different tau channel specifying tau vector list. cutoff exponential filtering detrending, weighted average, every point gets weight. can slow computation massively. However, many weights approximately zero. cutoff, say point weight less equal cutoff times maximum weight may ignored; cutoff = 0.05, weight less 5\ value parameter sensible value set anything else without good reason. degree degree polynomial use polynomial detrending. must positive integer. Set "auto" use Nolan's algorithm automatically find suitable value parameter (recommended). multi-channel images, possible different degree channel specifying degree vector list.

title: Detrend images. — detrending
text: detrended image, object class detrended_img.

title: Detrend images. — detrending
text: 4 detrending methods available: Robin Hood, boxcar, exponential filtering polynomial. Robin Hood described Nolan et al., 2018. others described Nolan et al., 2017. Boxcar detrending parameter \(l\) moving average detrending method using sliding window size \(2l + 1\). Exponential filtering detrending moving weighted average method parameter \(tau\) weights calculated exp\((- t / tau)\) \(t\) distance point interest. Polynomial detrending works fitting polynomial line series points correcting series remove trend detailed polynomial fit.

title: Detrend images. — detrending
text: Rory Nolan, Luis . J. Alvarez, Jonathan Elegheert, Maro Iliopoulou, G. Maria Jakobsdottir, Marina Rodriguez-Muñoz, . Radu Aricescu, Sergi Padilla-Parra; nandb—number brightness R novel automatic detrending algorithm, Bioinformatics, https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btx434.

title: Detrend images. — detrending
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## These examples are not run on CRAN because they take too long. ## You can still try them for yourself.  img <- ijtiff::read_tif(system.file("extdata", "bleached.tif",   package = "detrendr" )) corrected <- img_detrend_rh(img) corrected <- img_detrend_boxcar(img, "auto", purpose = "fcs", parallel = 2) corrected10 <- img_detrend_boxcar(img, 10, purpose = "fcs", parallel = 2) corrected50 <- img_detrend_boxcar(img, 50, purpose = "fcs", parallel = 2) corrected <- img_detrend_exp(img, "auto", purpose = "ffs", parallel = 2) corrected10 <- img_detrend_exp(img, 10, purpose = "ffs", parallel = 2) corrected50 <- img_detrend_exp(img, 50, purpose = "fcs", parallel = 2) corrected <- img_detrend_polynom(img, "auto", purpose = "ffs", parallel = 2) corrected2 <- img_detrend_polynom(img, 2, purpose = "ffs", parallel = 2) } # }

code: a <- array(seq_len(2^3), dim = rep(2, 3)) sum_frames(a) #> [1] 10 26 mean_frames(a) #> [1] 2.5 6.5

what: Get the sums/means/medians/variances of pillars of an ijtiff_img-style array. — pillar-stats
title: Get the sums/means/medians/variances of pillars of an ijtiff_img-style array. — pillar-stats
text: ijtiff_img-style array img (indexed img[y, x, channel, frame]), pillar xy channel ch defined img[y, x, ch, ]. functions compute mean, median variance pillar channel.

title: Get the sums/means/medians/variances of pillars of an ijtiff_img-style array. — pillar-stats
code: sum_pillars(img, parallel = FALSE)  mean_pillars(img, parallel = FALSE)  median_pillars(img, parallel = FALSE)  var_pillars(img, parallel = FALSE)

title: Get the sums/means/medians/variances of pillars of an ijtiff_img-style array. — pillar-stats
text: img 4-dimensional array style ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, channel, frame]) 3-dimensional array single channel ijtiff_img (indexed img[y, x, frame]). parallel like use multiple cores speed function? , set number cores , use available cores, use parallel = TRUE.

title: Get the sums/means/medians/variances of pillars of an ijtiff_img-style array. — pillar-stats
text: ijtiff_img-style array arr one frame. arr[y, x, ch, 1] equal mean(img[y, x, ch, ]), median(img[y, x, ch, ]), var(img[y, x, ch, ]).

title: Get the sums/means/medians/variances of pillars of an ijtiff_img-style array. — pillar-stats

what: Randomly draw balls from boxes. — rfromboxes
title: Randomly draw balls from boxes. — rfromboxes
text: Given number boxes specified number balls , randomly draw number balls boxes, recording many balls drawn . empty box drawn .

title: Randomly draw balls from boxes. — rfromboxes
code: rfromboxes(n, balls, weights = NULL)

title: Randomly draw balls from boxes. — rfromboxes
text: n natural number. number balls draw. balls vector natural numbers. number balls box begin . weights non-negative numeric vector length balls. relative probabilities drawing ball box. Default box equally likely drawn .

title: Randomly draw balls from boxes. — rfromboxes
text: vector natural numbers length balls. number balls drawn box.

title: Randomly draw balls from boxes. — rfromboxes
code: balls <- 1:10 rfromboxes(40, balls) #>  [1] 1 2 3 4 0 6 5 3 8 8 rfromboxes(40, balls, weights = c(rep(1, 9), 0)) #>  [1] 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 4 8 0

what: Randomly place balls in boxes. — rtoboxes
title: Randomly place balls in boxes. — rtoboxes
text: Given number boxes, randomly distribute n balls boxes.

title: Randomly place balls in boxes. — rtoboxes
code: rtoboxes(n, boxes, weights = NULL, capacities = NULL)

title: Randomly place balls in boxes. — rtoboxes
text: n natural number. number balls put boxes. boxes natural number. number boxes. weights non-negative numeric vector. relative probabilities putting ball box. Default box equally likely. capacities vector natural numbers. capacity box. Default box infinite capacity.

title: Randomly place balls in boxes. — rtoboxes
text: vector natural numbers length boxes. number balls placed box.

title: Randomly place balls in boxes. — rtoboxes
code: rtoboxes(30, 7) #> [1] 5 4 4 6 4 3 4 rtoboxes(30, 7, capacities = c(rep(1, 3), rep(7, 4))) #> [1] 1 1 1 7 7 6 7 rtoboxes(30, 7,   capacities = c(rep(1, 3), rep(70, 4)),   weights = c(rep(0.1, 6), 1) ) #> [1]  1  1  1  2  4  2 19
